title: Graves has higher HP/level than most bruisers
body:
More than Jax, Garen, Irelia, Camille, Fiora, Hecarim, Jarvan, and others

Not to mention his armor/level is insanely high considering how much free armor he gets

Why is this necessary?

replies.body:
If I had to guess. Graves is in a weird state. People think he’s supposed to be a marksman but he’s not. He’s some weird front-line ranged burst thing. There’s a reason why he was put in the unique playstyle class. 

A lot of the bruisers either have healing, or hard engage style play which means they’re intended to build defenses and be better for it. While Graves damage is so gated by his abilities and terrible attack speed he can’t really afford defensive items and still remain effective. So he’s given a bit more health to allow him to survive long enough for his passive to take effect. 

At least, in theory. In practice the line where a little bit more health to survive allows him to turn into an unstoppable killer is a bit fuzzy. 

He’s strong now but he changed from a below 50% winrate to well above after getting only 4 more hit points per level. That’s not much, in most cases that’s not even noticeable until late game when Graves’ effectiveness already drops. But it gave him the extra second or two for his passive to be effective.

Edit: I can’t do math apparently. They increased him by 8. That’s... a lot more. Still maintain the reason for why his health needs to be high-ish. But that probably overdid it.

I'd say his increased winrate is more because he got buffed and so people picked him up again and found that he was pretty good in the current state of the game. More HP is good, but with JUST that change it shouldn't have caused that big of a change.

Placebo buffs, man. Somehow, now he is strong, because he got 100 HP at level 18. Really, people will just follow anything.
Sure, he got some base AD as well, but still that wasn't enough. His winrate would go up slightly with the changes, but he went from one of  the worst junglers to the best because of placebo buffs, which means he wasn't that bad to begin with, it's just people blindly following challenger trends.

People stopped taking Electrocute/Dark Harvest on him and opted for Fleet is the bigger change. Fleet makes him SUPER sticky with his E and also causes him to duel most junglers a lot easier than electocute.

I never understood why people picked Electrocute or Dark Harvest. I always went for FFW and Sorcery for Celerity and Waterwalking. I had a lot of MS and AS to clear the jungle very healthy and fast and also the 1v1 was insane.

DH was extremely weak on Graves and Electrocute is just an ok ganking tool, but that's pretty much it.

The point is though that *in general* a champion will be given lower numbers in the stats that they are expected to build for. Zed is not expected to build any HP, so he is given a higher base HP stat so he can survive fights more easily, but in order to keep him balanced you then compensate by giving him a lower number in the stat that he is encouraged to build. 

It's also just really stupid to compare stats on champions in total isolation.

Yeah, I edited it. I even admitted that the previous information that I had was wrong, but downvote me all you want anyway

I was just explaining that to him as he seemingly didn't notice Proffesor Ward's quotation and got confused.

But since noone answering pissed you off: Graves is a Bruiser Marksman (you can notice that Riot's goal of 'making Marksman diverse on their own' means making them ranged versions of other classes). If he has that much free Health because he isn't expected to build it, so should get the other Bruisers. The fact that the one Bruiser that has range has more such safety is valid point to be pointed out. The problem is that he's balanced like Marksman, but doesn't build like one.

You however brought up Sion/Shen/Tank having more free AD than Zed. Sion is a tank, Zed is a Assasin, yes Tank does have more free AD because he isn't expected to build it, as you said, but Graves is expected to build Health as he's Bruiser and his range should be taken into consideration as safety aspect when balancing how much freebies he gets compared to other Bruisers. If his base stats are supposed to mark him as Marksman, maybe they should rework him again, so that he'd actually remind one.

If you look at all the stats of tanks/fighters vs dps champs (burst/sustained w/e), dps champs tend to have more base defensive stats than tanks and vice versa. 

The reasons is to combat the lack of stats with their natural build tendencies. So that dps champs can have some rigidity, while tanks can still do damage without having to forsake their natural build path. 

Which also why often you'll see tanks wanted to go **FULL DAMAGE 4/2/0 KDA 10:01 video (not click bait)** games fail a lot of times because they're supplementing stats that are already being reinforced by their base stats, and therefore leaving the the rest of their kit to fall off because those abilities don't benefit from the bullding "off-meta" or "off-build" items. 

Not to say that it's set in stone that YOU MUST build a champ the way Riot recommends, it just comes at a cost of kit efficacy.
